info:
I developed the marketing website for Gigabuddy, an innovative Slack bot designed to streamline the onboarding process for new team members. The site was crafted as a concise, impactful one-page design, focused on two primary objectives: capturing potential user interest through a 'Register Interest' feature and providing information for prospective investors.

The landing page was meticulously designed to showcase Gigabuddy's key features and benefits, emphasizing how it revolutionizes team onboarding through Slack integration.

Databeast is an advanced analytics platform designed to provide real-time insights into the dynamic NFT market. Our intuitive interface leverages Chart.js to visually represent complex data through interactive charts and graphs, offering users a comprehensive understanding of NFT trends. A key feature is our live top 100 volume leaderboard, which tracks and displays the highest-performing NFTs in real-time, enabling users to stay ahead in this rapidly evolving digital asset space.

Dropbeast is an innovative platform revolutionizing the NFT ecosystem by streamlining airdrop claims and wallet farming processes. Our user-centric design offers a seamless experience, empowering users to effortlessly participate in airdrops and engage in farming activities. Leveraging Mantine components, we've crafted a consistent tabular layout that enhances usability while maintaining a sleek, modern aesthetic. Built on the robust foundation of Next.js and Firebase, Dropbeast delivers lightning-fast performance and unwavering reliability.

As a key contributor to Yarra Valley Water's impactful Choose Tap campaign, I spearheaded the development of an innovative website aimed at raising public awareness about plastic bottle consumption and promoting sustainable hydration practices.

This pivotal project, which marked my debut at Hardhat, showcased my ability to create engaging digital experiences that merge education with user interaction.

The cornerstone of the website was an immersive, scroll-based landing page featuring dynamic infographics that captivated visitors while conveying crucial information about the environmental impact of single-use plastics. I ensured that complex data was presented in an easily digestible, visually appealing format that resonated with a diverse audience.

The crown jewel of the site was the Tap Finder map, a powerful tool that I implemented using Google Maps API integration. This feature allowed users to effortlessly locate free water refill stations across Australia, effectively removing barriers to adopting more sustainable hydration habits.
The RMIT Open Day landing page was designed to engage prospective students and showcase the school through an innovative and interactive user experience.

I designed and built the 2024 site for CCM, doing away with their existing Wix application and providing a bespoke cms using Sanity.io, single click deployment using Vercel and faster page loading using Next.js static builds.

Ventia, a leading essential infrastructure services provider in Australia and New Zealand, underwent a significant digital transformation. As part of the development team, I contributed to rebuilding their legacy Rails site. A key aspect of this project was the introduction of React components through rails-react, a strategic decision aimed at future-proofing the platform for subsequent developers. This integration enhanced the site's flexibility and maintainability, aligning with Ventia's position as a major player in the infrastructure sector.

In 2019, a staggering 424,144 Australian Business Numbers (ABNs) were deregistered, signaling a concerning trend in the Australian business landscape. CGU Insurance, a company with a long-standing commitment to supporting ambitious Australians, decided to take action.

To reverse this alarming trend, Prime Motive engaged me to collaborate with their senior developer on a crucial front-end campaign site. This project was part of a larger, multi-faceted initiative dubbed 'ABN Rescue', aimed at reinvigorating Australia's entrepreneurial spirit. Working in collaboration with The Monkeys, a renowned creative agency handling television commercials (TVCs) and billboard campaigns, we embarked on a mission to rescue Australia's ambition and reignite its business landscape.

My role as a front-end developer was pivotal in bringing the digital aspect of this campaign to life. Working closely with the senior Prime Motive developer, I contributed to crafting an engaging, responsive, and innovative website featuring a vertically scrolling animated UX that served as a central hub for information, resources, and support for struggling and aspiring business owners.

The site featured intuitive navigation, ensuring that despite its innovative design, users could easily access the information they needed.
